citation.article-title: Halosarcina pallida gen. nov., sp. nov., a halophilic archaeon from a low-salt, sulfide-rich spring.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Halosarcina [Ha.lo.sar.ciâ€²na. Gr. n. hals, halos salt; L. fem. n. sarcina a package; N.L. fem. n. Halosarcina a salt (-loving) package].
Cells form sarcina-like clusters during the exponential growth phase and occur singly or in pairs in late exponential and stationary phases.
Chemo-organotrophic, growing on a wide range of substrates, including single and complex carbon sources.
Reduce nitrate to nitrite aerobically without the formation of gas.
Cells contain phosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol phosphate methyl ester, but phosphatidylglycerol sulfate is absent.
Two glycolipids are present that are chromatographically identical to S-DGD-1 and DGD-1.
The type species is Halosarcina pallida.
